Package racing.logic

Class Summary
BonusObject  
Car Car class, with default values.
CheckPoint Class that represents a checkpoint, which is of type line.
CollisionObject Class that represents a specific type of object that will be colliding with the players car.
Configuration Represents a keyboard layout for use in-game, which can be used in another game session.
Conversions  
CPUPlayer Deprecated. since we didn't implement AI-Logic
DelayObject  
Drifter The drifter lacks in speed but has good acceleration and the ability of sharp turning.
DynamicObject Deprecated. since the only "moving" object is the car.
FinishLine Deprecated. since the finishline is considered to be the first checkpoint.
GameEngine  
GameSession Holds data of a particular game session.
GenericObject Super class that represents all objects in-game.
GrandPrix Deprecated. not able to provide more maps and do a set of races
HighScores Read write operations in files to present / save the overall highscores of players.
HumanPlayer Deprecated. since the only player is human.
JumpingPlatform Object that makes car's player jump and have a boost in speed.
keyNotation  
Line Serves as super to its superclasses.
Map  
Obstacle  
OutOfBounds As the name implies, if the car touches this object then it is automatically destroyed: simulation of pit fall.
Player Represents a player, holding name and car.
PlayerSimulation Deprecated. use for testing purposes
Point  
Race Race holds a Map data and lap information.
RacingLogic Logic that implements the game.
Runner Runner has tons of acceleration , medium speed and low hit points.
Solid Solid is the default car, being the most balanced.
Speeder The speeder lacks in handling but has tons of speed.
StaticObject Is the parent class of Lines <-> Dynamic Objects
Wall Represents a Wall object ( thin line, unbreakable ).
